summary.para: Returns an interface pointer that can be used to enumerate the context properties in this context.

param.name: ppEnumContextProps
param.para: The address of the variable that receives the new interface pointer.

returns.para: This method can return the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_OUTOFMEMORY, E_UNEXPECTED, E_FAIL, and S_OK.

summary.para: Retrieves the specified context property from the context.

param.name: rGuid
param.para: The GUID that uniquely identifies the context property to be retrieved.

param.name: pFlags
param.para: The address of the variable that receives the flags associated with the property.

param.name: ppUnk
param.para: The address of the variable that receives the interface pointer of the requested context property.

returns.para: This method can return the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_OUTOFMEMORY, E_UNEXPECTED, E_FAIL, and S_OK.

summary.para: Removes the specified context property from the context.

param.name: rPolicyId
param.para: The GUID that uniquely identifies the context property to be removed.

returns.para: This method can return the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_OUTOFMEMORY, E_UNEXPECTED, E_FAIL, and S_OK.

summary.para: Adds the specified context property to the object context.

param.name: rpolicyId
param.para: A GUID that uniquely identifies this context property.

param.name: flags
param.para: This parameter is reserved and must be zero.

param.name: pUnk
param.para: A pointer to the context property to be added.

returns.para: This method can return the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_OUTOFMEMORY, E_UNEXPECTED, E_FAIL, and S_OK.

remarks.para: An instance of this interface for the current context can be obtained using .
